image.altText: Three women in black formal wear walk out of court, one in front holding folders and looking at camera

props.synopsis: Lawyers for the family of Kumanjayi Johnson, who died in Alice Springs while under public guardianship, tell an inquest his family felt left out of his care and weren't told he went missing on the night he disappeared.

title.children: Inquest into death of Aboriginal man in care hears of support gaps

image.altText: A patch of the NT police force emblem on an unidentified officer's uniform

props.synopsis: Police are investigating the circumstances around a woman's death after a house fire in the Alice Springs suburb of Sadadeen.

title.children: Police investigating woman's death in Alice Springs house fire

image.altText: Federal shadow minister for Indigenous Australians Jacinta Price standing and speaking outside a voting centre.

props.synopsis: Lisa Siebert has called for the Liberal Party's proposed royal commission into child sexual abuse in Indigenous communities to be expanded to all Australian children.

title.children: Coalition candidate diverges from Jacinta Price on royal commission call

image.altText: A woman in a singlet at the pub

props.synopsis: At the Humpty Doo pub in Darwin's rural area, thousands of kilometres from Canberra, the views of punters reflect the challenges facing candidates nationwide this election.

title.children: Putting politics to the punters at the Humpty Doo pub

image.altText: Hands holding a mobile phone displaying a gambling app

props.synopsis: Crossbench politicians in the Northern Territory are calling for a ban on gifts from corporate bookmakers to members of the NT’s gambling regulator, after revelations its chair declared he had accepted hospitality from gambling companies.

title.children: Call for ban on gifts from gambling companies to members of NT regulator

image.altText: A group of Aboriginal rangers sitting in a shed in plastic white chairs, surrounding a map of the region.

props.synopsis: A live fire mapping service, used by Indigenous rangers, firefighting agencies and pastoralists in northern Australia, is on track to run out of funding during the region's peak fire season.

title.children: Vital firefighting tool at risk as northern Australia enters fire season

image.altText: A young woman and man holding a newspaper together

props.synopsis: Two student reporters scramble to cover Harvard’s funding freeze amid escalating tensions with Donald Trump.

title.children: Teen journalists at the centre of the fight between Trump and Harvard

image.altText: A young man gestures while speaking and sitting on the couch

props.synopsis: Dissatisfaction with the Albanese government's stance on Israel-Palestine among many Arab and Muslim voters threatens to unseat Labor MPs, in some places for the first time.

title.children: This has been a Labor seat since 1984. That could change this election

image.altText: Two middle-aged men use tongs at a barbecue in the park.

props.synopsis: Both the PM and the opposition leader have issued Easter messages to the public, and are spending the day in their home towns. Follow live.

title.children: PM heads to mass while Dutton hosts barbecue for Easter Sunday

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Shadow housing minister rules out return to public service WFH ban
Dutton attends barbecue in Ipswich, plans a low-key Easter Sunday
Albanese talks global geopolitics on UK podcast, begins the day with Easter mass

image.altText: Zali Steggall speaks in front of journalists at a press conference in a park.

props.synopsis: Voters in traditionally safe seats are pinning their hopes on independent and non-major party candidates, but it takes more than just dreams to flip these electorates.

title.children: How a safe seat gets flipped by a disruptor

image.altText: Powerlines suspended between towers against orange dusk  sky.

props.synopsis: Nuclear? Renewables? Gas? Coal? And what about emissions targets? What the two major parties are offering on energy at this election.

title.children: Your guide to the energy divide at the federal election

image.altText: Search helicopter 190425

props.synopsis: Australia is continuing to see a deadly start to the Easter long weekend, with five drowning deaths and two people missing after being swept into waters along the east coast.

title.children: Five drowning deaths, two missing as deadly Easter long weekend continues

image.altText: A young girl with her brown hair in a pony tail in a pink jumper holds her hands under her chin as she gazes at a keyboard.

props.synopsis: Parents and researchers hope the discovery of a genetic mutation could help find treatments for children living with previously undiagnosed neurodevelopmental disorders.

title.children: Discovery of genetic mutation leads to first diagnosis for dozens of kids

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed and a serious look on his face. The Hard Quiz has been added behind his head

props.synopsis: It's all well and good to be a know-it-all on the couch. Time to walk all that talk, let's play, HARD!

title.children: Think you could be a Hard Quiz contestant? I've heard that before

image.altText: Bluey characters in puppet form with their puppeteers

props.synopsis: Experts weigh in on whether it's OK for parents to have downtime on their phones instead of playing with their children.

title.children: The Bluey episode that raises questions about parents' phone use

image.altText: Men holding dead bodies wrapped in white sheets

props.synopsis: The strikes come as Israeli troops vow to ramp up attacks in an effort to put pressure on Hamas to release its hostages.

title.children: Israeli strikes on Gaza kill more than 90 people in 48 hours

image.altText: Oscar Jenkins charged

props.synopsis: Russian authorities have laid criminal charges against Australian man Oscar Jenkins for being a "mercenary in an armed conflict", four months after the former teacher was captured while fighting for Ukrainian forces.

title.children: Captured Australian fighter Oscar Jenkins facing 15 years in Russian jail

image.altText: Damien Hardwick wearing a red Suns polo

props.synopsis: Gold Coast Suns coach Damien Hardwick does not believe Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan should have commented on whether Richmond's Noah Balta should have been allowed to play while facing sentencing for assault.

title.children: 'Absolute mockery': Hardwick takes aim at Victorian premier over Balta comments

image.altText: A woman dressed up as a grandmother, standing on an apple float in a parade.

props.synopsis: Thanks to a "chance seedling in Granny Smith's backyard", we now have the Granny Smith apple as one of Australia's predominant varieties, with an annual festival held in her honour.

title.children: How a 'chance seedling' in a Sydney backyard became a fruit staple for the world

image.altText: Draymond Green and Amen Thompson grapple for the ball

props.synopsis: The latest episode in arguably the most bitter feud in the NBA between the Rockets and Warriors is one of several juicy subplots as the 2025 playoffs get underway.

title.children: The NBA playoffs are here and one of the league's most bitter feuds is back

image.altText: A man with a beard, holding his baby girl.

props.synopsis: It's been a wet three months in the small communities of Hidden Valley and Paluma in north Queensland where the effects of a massive tropical low that bombed the region and brought widespread flooding in late January are still being felt.

title.children: Tourism operator lost $100,000 in bookings due to north Queensland rain event

image.altText: the band yachtley crew - seven men dressed as sailors, some holding musical instruments - pose for the camera

props.synopsis: Yacht rock is as contentious as it is influential. This band wants to keep the fun parts of the genre alive.

title.children: A yacht rock cover band thought they'd see no interest. They were wrong

image.altText: Woman wearing intricate gold costume and black makeup on face.

props.synopsis: If Donald Trump can be president, Deborah Kelly reasoned, then she could start a religion. The artist's project began as a parody, but soon morphed into a genuine source of spiritual solace for a growing community.

title.children: This religion started as a 'joke', then it took on a life of its own

image.altText: Three rugby league players in pink celebrate a try.

props.synopsis: Nathan Cleary becomes the Panthers' greatest point-scorer as his side makes a spectacular return to form in a statement win over the Roosters.

title.children: 'The premiers are back': Dominant Panthers exact revenge on Roosters

image.altText: Ellie Carpenter and Caitlin Foord battle for the ball

props.synopsis: Ellie Carpenter's Lyon takes a major step towards the Champions League final by downing Arsenal — a side featuring Caitlin Foord, Steph Catley and Kyra Cooney-Cross.

title.children: Carpenter a step closer to elusive title after 'strange' battle against Matildas teammates

image.altText: Gout Gout waves with his left hand after winning his Stawell gift heat.

props.synopsis: Rising sprint stars Gout Gout and Lachlan Kennedy comfortably qualify for the Stawell Gift semifinals to be held on Easter Monday.

title.children: Gout and Kennedy storm into Stawell Gift semis

image.altText: A man seen praying through a window

props.synopsis: Lawyers for the American Civil Liberties Union had filed urgent requests in multiple courts, after reports some men had already been loaded onto buses and were told they were to be deported.

title.children: US Supreme Court halts deportation of Venezuelans in immigration custody

image.altText: Grass grows in a paddock beneath a clear sky.

props.synopsis: The introduced species is crucial for graziers but environmentalists say it poses unacceptable dangers. With a decision about its status looming, both sides are putting their cases forward.

title.children: Industry backbone or massive threat? Debate rages over buffel grass

image.altText: A tiny baby short-necked turtle held up by someone in their hand near a lake.

props.synopsis: Native freshwater turtles have declined by up to 91 per cent in parts of the River Murray, but Indigenous rangers and conservationists are fighting to bring them back.

title.children: First Nations rangers fight to save 'vacuum cleaners of the river'

image.altText: Three wasps nibbling on a piece of bacon.

props.synopsis: European wasps are swarming regional Victoria, forcing businesses to close and residents to stay indoors, as unusually warm weather causes their numbers to spike.

title.children: Cafes shut, children hide indoors as European wasps terrorise Victoria

image.altText: A young girl peers from a brown torn curtain.

props.synopsis: Pakistan has expelled more than 80,000 Afghan nationals since the end of March, a senior official said, as part of a renewed crackdown targeting foreigners the government deems to be residing 'illegally' in the country.

title.children: Pakistan drives out 80,000 Afghans in repatriation campaign

image.altText: Police car and police tape outside a house

props.synopsis: An eight-year-old boy remains in an induced coma after the body of a woman, believed to be his mother, was found in a burnt-out car in Sydney's south-west.

title.children: Boy remains in coma after woman's body found in burnt-out car

image.altText: Waves break close to a beach with bush on the edge of the cliffs.

props.synopsis: Organisers were hoping for better surfing conditions after competition was suspended after one heat in the men's opening round on Friday.

title.children: Surfing called off at Bells Beach due to unfavourable conditions

image.altText: A photo of a grey overcast sky over mangroves and water.

props.synopsis: Emergency services say they will continue to monitor ex-cyclone Errol as it moves through the Kimberley, bringing welcome rain ahead of the busy tourist season.

title.children: Ex-cyclone Errol 'a dodged bullet' as it crosses Kimberley as tropical low

image.altText: A robot racing in a marathon

props.synopsis: The robots came in all different shapes and sizes. One looked almost human, with feminine features and the ability to wink and smile.

title.children: More than 20 robots race alongside humans at half marathon in Beijing
